intro: Acianthera lojae, commonly known as the Loja orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate floral structure and vibrant, often purple or pinkish petals. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are specialized for pollination by specific insect species, showcasing the plant's adaptation to its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Acianthera lojae is considered a vulnerable species.
